chapter.para: &MESH; works with other &AWS; services to provide additional solutions for your business challenges. This topic identifies services that either use &MESH; to add functionality, or services that &MESH; uses to perform tasks.

abstract.para: Learn about how to create resources for &MESH; using an &CFNlong; template.

section.para: &MESH; is integrated with &CFNlong;, a service that helps you model and set up your &AWS; resources so that you can spend less time creating and managing your resources and infrastructure. You create a template that describes all the &AWS; resources that you want, for example an &MESH; mesh, and &CFN; takes care of provisioning and configuring those resources for you.

When you use &CFN;, you can reuse your template to set up your &MESH; resources consistently and repeatedly. Just describe your resources once, and then provision the same resources over and over in multiple &AWS; accounts and Regions.

To provision and configure resources for &MESH; and related services, you must understand &CFN; templates. Templates are formatted text files in JSON or YAML. These templates describe the resources that you want to provision in your &CFN; stacks. If you're unfamiliar with JSON or YAML, you can use &CFN; Designer to help you get started with &CFN; templates. For more information, see What is &CFN; Designer? in the &guide-cfn-user;.

&MESH; supports creating meshes, routes, virtual nodes, virtual routers, and virtual services
in &CFN;. For more information, including examples of JSON and YAML templates for your &MESH; resources, see &MESH; resource type reference in the &guide-cfn-user;.
